member.name: M:Ponderosa.U2mv.Results.DataResult.GetSlice(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a slice the set of fields which are part of the specified linked subset.
member.remarks: Results may contain a set of fields which have multiple sub-values linked by index. This can be visualized by thinking of a result row as a table having the field names on the left and a set of columns representing the indexed sub-values to the right. This function takes a vertical slice of one of the columns on the left and returns it as a separate result. Fields that don't have a value at the specified index are null in the returned result. Any result fields which are not part of the linked subset are included in the returned result as-is.

member.summary: Adds an object to the end of the queue. If queue is full, this method will block until another thread calls one of the Dequeue methods. This method will wait "Timeout.Infinite" until queue has a free slot.

member.summary: Adds an object to the end of the queue. If queue is full, this method will block until another thread calls one of the Dequeue methods or millisecondsTimeout expires. If timeout, method will throw QueueTimeoutException.

member.summary: Non-blocking version of Enqueue(). If Enqueue is successfull, this will return true; otherwise false if queue is full.

member.name: M:Ponderosa.CSharp.BlockingQueue`1.Dequeue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes and returns the object at the beginning of the Queue. If queue is empty, method will block until another thread calls one of the Enqueue methods or millisecondsTimeout expires. If timeout, method will throw QueueTimeoutException.
member.returns: The object that is removed from the beginning of the Queue.

member.name: M:Ponderosa.CSharp.BlockingQueue`1.TryDequeue(`0@)
member.summary: Non-blocking version of Dequeue. Will return false if queue is empty and set value to null, otherwise will return true and set value to the dequeued object.
member.param: The object that is removed from the beginning of the Queue or null if empty.

member.summary: Removes an object from the Queue.

member.name: M:Ponderosa.CSharp.BlockingQueue`1.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.param: The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from Queue. The Array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

member.name: M:Ponderosa.CSharp.BlockingQueue`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: GetEnumerator not implemented. You can't enumerate the active queue as you would an array as it is dynamic with active gets and puts. You could if you locked it first and unlocked after enumeration, but that does not work well for GetEnumerator. The recommended method is to Get Values and enumerate the returned array copy. That way the queue is locked for only a short time and a copy returned so that can be safely enumerated using the array's enumerator. You could also create a custom enumerator that would dequeue the objects until empty queue, but that is a custom need.

member.name: M:Ponderosa.U2mv.Results.HeaderDetailResult.GetHeaderSlice(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a slice the set of header fields which are part of the specified linked subset.
member.remarks: Return a slice the set of header fields which are part of the specified linked subset. Results may contain a set of fields which have multiple sub-values linked by index. This can be visualized by thinking of a result row as a table having the field names on the left and a set of columns representing the indexed sub-values to the right. This function takes a vertical slice of one of the columns on the left and returns it as a separate result. Fields that don't have a value at the specified index are null in the returned result. Any header fields which are not part of the linked subset are included in the returned result as-is.

member.name: M:Ponderosa.U2mv.Results.HeaderDetailResult.GetHeaderDetailSlice(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a slice from the fields which are linked to the specified header field combined with a corresponding slice from the detail fields..
member.remarks: Return a slice from the fields which are linked to the specified header field combined with a corresponding slice from the detail fields.. Header fields returned are null if they don't have a value at that position. Any fields of the original result that are not part of the set of linked fields are included in the result as-is. Detail rows are only returned if they have data in the specified slice. Otherwise, the rules are the same as for header fields.

member.summary: Return the number of elements in the specified header field if it contains a list.
member.remarks: Return the number of elements in the specified header field if it contains a list. Otherwise, returns either 1 or 0 depending on whether the value is empty.

member.name: T:Ponderosa.Config.JavaPropertiesWrapper
member.summary: Class providing type-safe retrieval of Java Properties values.
member.remarks: Optionally loads properties from a file or other resource. If a value doesn't exist then a default value of "", false, 0 or null is returned depending on the return value of the accessor method. Also, provides mechanisum for a context specific value to override a general value. So if the key is "name" and the context is "class" then the value for the key "class.name" is used if it exists. If it doesn't, then the value for "name" is returned.
